H0.text: Completed half of one rotation is what Earth has done from sunrise to sunset on a spring day when daylight and night are about the same.

H1.text: Earth has been in the shadow of the Moon from sunrise to sunset on a day in early spring when the hours of daylight and night are about the same.

H2.text: The Moon has circled Earth one time from sunrise to sunset on a spring day when daylight and night hours are roughly equal.

H3.text: Moved to the opposite side of the Sun is what Earth does from sunrise to sunset on a spring day when daylight and night hours are about the same.

A4.text: Earth rotates once in about 24 hours with respect to the Sun
